column13: Promote a healthy work-life balance by offering flexible work arrangements, wellness programs, and other initiatives that support physical and mental well-being.

column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: A satisfied workforce tends to be more productive and efficient. By prioritising the well-being of our staff, providing the necessary resources, and fostering a healthy work-life balance, we enhance productivity while reducing stress and burnout, ultimately contributing to the long-term sustainability of the business.

column7: We trade only with recognised, reputable and credit-worthy third parties and have long-standing relationships with our suppliers that last several years or more. We currently do not have any joint venture arrangements and have minimal change in our supplier list from year to year, domestically and in our overseas subsidiaries.

Assessment of the health and safety impacts of product and service categories
column13: AI algorithms should undergo rigorous testing and validation to ensure their accuracy and reliability in medical diagnosis, treatment planning, and decision-making. They should be designed to minimise the risk of errors or adverse outcomes.

column6: Assessment of the health and safety impacts of product and service categories
column13: Developers should strive to minimise biases in AI algorithms, ensuring they do not disproportionately favour or discriminate against any specific group of patients. Regular monitoring and auditing of AI systems can help identify and address potential biases.

column6: Assessment of the health and safety impacts of product and service categories
column13: Medical software incorporating AI should adhere to relevant regulatory guidelines and standards. Compliance with regulatory frameworks, such as FDA (US Food and Drug Administration) regulations, is essential to ensure the safety and effectiveness of AI-powered medical software.

column6: Incidents of non-compliance concerning the health and safety impacts of products and services
Requirements for product and service information and labeling
column7: Promoting responsible AI in medical software requires collaboration among software developers, healthcare providers, regulatory bodies, and other stakeholders. Pro Medicus must strike a balance between harnessing the potential of AI in improving healthcare outcomes while upholding ethical standards and patient safety.

column13: Medical software should adhere to strict data protection standards, ensuring patient data is collected, stored, and processed securely. Compliance with privacy regulations, such as HIPAA (Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act), is crucial.

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: We have published a Privacy Statement, which ensures compliance with privacy laws where the Company operates. We have implemented various systems and processes internally to manage privacy, ensure compliance, and mitigate risks.

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column7: The risk of transgressing others' IP and the risk of IP being lost due to theft, copying by third parties or a rogue employee has been managed and mitigated through insurance, agreements, the ownership of critical patents and active surveillance. Should the likelihood of an inadvertent IP transgression arise, the Company can change and update product software to avoid any continuing patent breaches.
